study_plan_entry.title: Heterogeneous catalysts: methods of preparation and characterization

free_text.Learning outcomes: [br/]To give an insight to modern preparation methods of heterogeneous catalysts and basic approach of their characterization.
free_text.Content: 1. Introduction: [br/][br/][li]Catalytic function in terms of potential energy[br/][li]Kinetics and mechanisms of surface reactions[br/][li]Influence of diffusion on overall kinetics[br/][li]Activity/selectivity and aspects of its determination[br/][br/][br/]2. Catalyst preparation:[br/][br/][li]Materials and methods[br/][li]Precipitated catalysts[br/][li]Catalyst preparation by mechanical mixing[br/][li]Supported catalysts[br/][li]Skeletal catalysts[br/][li]Zeolites and meso-porous materials[br/][li]Structured catalysts[br/][br/][br/]3. Catalyst characterization:[br/][br/][li]Surface morphology studies: specific surface area (SSA), pore-size distribution (PSD), specific chemisorption, transmission electronic microscopy (TEM), [scanning electronic microscopy (SEM), electron micro-diffraction (EMD)[br/][li]Chemical composition and structure: powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), atomic-absorption spectroscopy (AAS), X-ray fluorescence (XRF), UV-vis absorption, thermo-gravimetric analysis (TGA), differential thermo-gravimetry (DTGA)[br/][li]Surface acid-basic and electronic properties: temperature programmed desorption (TPD), temperature programmed adsorption (TPA), and temperature programmed oxidation/reduction (TPO/TPR), Infra-Red spectroscopy (FT-IR), Raman spectroscopy, X-ray photo-electron spectroscopy (XPS-ESCA).[br/][br/][br/]4. Examples of heterogeneous catalysts in practice:[br/][br/][li]Automotive exhaust catalysts[br/][li]Hydrogen production[br/][li]Selective hydrogenation
free_text.Note: This course is postponed until Fall 2010.[br/]
